an7.63:4.1: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, went to the home of the householder Anāthapiṇḍika,
an7.63:4.2: where he sat on the indicated seat.
an7.63:4.3: Now at that time people in Anāthapiṇḍika’s home were making a dreadful racket.
an7.63:4.4: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
an7.63:4.5: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an7.63:5.1: “Householder, what’s with the people making that dreadful racket in your home? You’d think it was fishermen hauling in a catch!”
an7.63:5.2: “Sir, that’s my daughter-in-law Sujātā. She’s been brought here from a wealthy family.
an7.63:5.3: She doesn’t obey her mother-in-law or father-in-law or her husband. And she does not honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Buddha.”
an7.63:6.1: Then the Buddha addressed Sujātā, saying,
an7.63:6.3: “Yes, sir,” she replied. She went up to the Buddha,
an7.63:6.4: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an7.63:7.1: “Sujātā, a man can have seven kinds of wife.
an7.63:7.3: A wife like a killer, a wife like a thief, a wife like a lord, a wife like a mother, a wife like a sister, a wife like a friend, and a wife like a slave.
an7.63:7.4: These are the kinds of wife that a man can have.
an7.63:7.5: Which one of these are you?”
an7.63:7.6: “Sir, I don’t understand the detailed meaning of what the Buddha has said in brief .
an7.63:7.7: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”
an7.63:7.8: “Well then, Sujātā, listen and pay close attention,
an7.63:8.1: “With a mind full of hate and no kindness,
an7.63:8.2: lusting for others, looking down on her husband,
an7.63:8.3: she longs to murder the one who paid the price for her.
an7.63:8.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:8.5: is called a wife and a murderer.
an7.63:9.1: A woman’s husband earns his wealth
an7.63:9.2: by working at a craft, trade, or farming.
an7.63:9.3: And even if it’s only a little, she wants to take it.
an7.63:9.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:9.5: is called a wife and a thief.
an7.63:10.1: She’s a lazy glutton who doesn’t want to work.
an7.63:10.2: Her words are harsh, fierce, and rude.
an7.63:10.3: She rules over him, though he rises early.
an7.63:10.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:10.5: is called a wife and a lord.
an7.63:11.2: looking after her husband like a mother her child.
an7.63:11.3: She keeps the wealth that he’s earned secure.
an7.63:11.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:11.5: is called a wife and a mother.
an7.63:12.2: as a younger sister respects her elder.
an7.63:12.3: Conscientious, she does what her husband says.
an7.63:12.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:12.5: is called a wife and a sister.
an7.63:13.2: like one reunited with a long-lost friend.
an7.63:13.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:13.5: is called a wife and a friend.
an7.63:14.1: She has no anger when threatened with violence by the rod.
an7.63:14.3: she endures her husband and does what he says.
an7.63:14.4: A man’s wife of this sort
an7.63:14.5: is called a wife and a slave.
an7.63:15.1: The kinds of wives here called
an7.63:15.4: when their body breaks up they go to hell.
an7.63:16.1: But the kinds of wives here called
an7.63:16.3: virtuous, restrained for a long time,
an7.63:16.4: when their body breaks up they go to a good place.”
an7.63:17.1: Sujātā, these are the seven kinds of wife that a man can have.
an7.63:17.2: Which one of these are you?”
an7.63:17.3: “Sir, from this day forth may the Buddha remember me as a wife like a slave.”
